trans-unit.source: Represents a list control that encapsulates a group of radio button controls.

In this topic: - [Introduction](#introduction) - [Specifying List Layout](#specifying_list_layout) - [Accessibility](#accessibility) - [Declarative Syntax](#declarative_syntax) ## Introduction The RadioButtonList control provides page developers with a single-selection radio button group that can be dynamically generated through data binding.
It contains an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.Items%2A> collection with members that correspond to individual items on the list.
To determine which item is selected, test the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.SelectedItem%2A> property of the list.
## Specifying List Layout You can specify how the list is rendered by setting the and properties.
For information about layout options, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout> enumeration.
By default, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.RepeatDirection%2A> is set to `RepeatDirection.Vertical`.
Setting this property to `RepeatDirection.Horizontal` causes the control to render the list horizontally.
Some <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.RepeatLayout%2A> settings do not allow horizontal layout.
For more information, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout> enumeration.
> [!CAUTION] > This control can be used to display user input, which might include malicious client script.
Check any information that is sent from a client for executable script, SQL statements, or other code before displaying it in your application.
You can use validation controls to verify user input before displaying the input text in a RadioButtonList control.
ASP.NET provides an input request validation feature to block script and HTML in user input.

For more information, see [Securing Standard Controls](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md), [How to: Protect Against Script Exploits in a Web Application by Applying HTML Encoding to Strings](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md), and [Validating User Input in ASP.NET Web Pages](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

## Accessibility For information about how to configure this control so that it generates markup that conforms to accessibility standards, see [Accessibility in Visual Studio and ASP.NET](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) and [ASP.NET Controls and Accessibility](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Declarative Syntax ```              ```
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> class.
Gets or sets the distance (in pixels) between the border and the contents of the table cell.
This property applies only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.RepeatLayout%2A> property is set to `RepeatLayout.Table`.
Use this property to control the spacing between the contents of a cell and the cell's border.
The padding amount specified is added to all four sides of a cell.
It uses the height of the tallest cell in the table and the width of the widest cell in the table.
The resulting cell size is applied uniformly to all cells in the table.
Individual cell sizes cannot be specified.
The distance (in pixels) between the border and the contents of the table cell.
The default is -1, which indicates that this property is not set.
Gets or sets the distance (in pixels) between adjacent table cells.
This property applies only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.RepeatLayout%2A> property is set to `RepeatLayout.Table`.
Use this property to control the spacing between individual cells in the table.
This property is applied both vertically and horizontally.
The distance (in pixels) between adjacent table cells.
The default is -1, which indicates that this property is not set.
Creates a style object that is used internally by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList"></xref> control to implement all style-related properties.
The CreateControlStyle method is used primarily by control developers in custom control that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> class.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> that contains the style properties of the control.
Searches the current naming container for a server control with the specified ID and path offset.
The FindControl method always returns the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList"></xref> object.
The FindControl method is used primarily by control developers in custom controls that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> class.
The FindControl method overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.FindControl%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method of the base <xref:System.Web.UI.Control> class.
You should not override this version of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.FindControl%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
The identifier for the control to find.
The number of controls up the page control hierarchy needed to reach a naming container.
The current <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList"></xref>.
Retrieves the style of the specified item type at the specified index in the list control.
The GetItemStyle method is used primarily by control developers in custom controls that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> class.
The style attribute for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control applies to all list items that are contained by the control.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control to examine or set the style attribute for the control and its list items.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemType"></xref> enumeration values.
An ordinal index that specifies the location of the item in the list control.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>, indicating that style attributes are not set on individual list items in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList"></xref> control.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList"></xref> control contains a footer section.
The HasFooter property is used primarily by control developers in custom controls that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> class.

Footers are not supported when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.RepeatLayout%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout>.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>, indicating that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList"></xref> does not contain a footer section.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList"></xref> control contains a heading section.
The HasHeader property is used primarily by control developers in custom controls that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> class.

Headers are not supported when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.RepeatLayout%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout>.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>, indicating that a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList"></xref> control does not contain a heading section.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList"></xref> control contains separators between items in the list.
The HasSeparators property is used primarily by control developers in custom controls that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> class.

Separators are not supported when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.RepeatLayout%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout>.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>, indicating that a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList"></xref> control does not contain separators.
Processes the posted data for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList"></xref> control.
The LoadPostData method is used primarily by control developers in custom controls that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> class.
The LoadPostData method indicates whether the state of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control has changed.
In other words, it determines whether the selected list item in the control is the same as the last posted value.
A user changing the selected item in the control changes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.SelectedIndex%2A> value for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control.
If the same list item is selected in the control, or if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control is disabled, LoadPostData returns `false`.
When the LoadPostData method returns `true` for a control, the ASP.NET page framework invokes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.RaisePostDataChangedEvent%2A> method for the control.
The key identifier for the control, used to index the `postCollection`.
A <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection"></xref> that contains value information indexed by control identifiers.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList"></xref> is different from the last posting; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Raises the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control.Init"></xref> event.
The event data.
Notifies the ASP.NET application that the state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList"></xref> control has changed.
The RaisePostDataChangedEvent method is used primarily by control developers in custom controls that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> class.

The ASP.NET page framework calls the RaisePostDataChangedEvent method on a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.LoadPostData%2A> method indicates that the state of the list items have changed in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control.

The RaisePostDataChangedEvent method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.OnSelectedIndexChanged%2A> method to raise the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.SelectedIndexChanged> event.
Control developers can override the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.OnSelectedIndexChanged%2A> method to perform custom processing when the user changes the selected item in the control.
The `RaisePostBackEvent` method can optionally perform validation before raising the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.SelectedIndexChanged> event for the control.

To validate a group of controls on the page when a list item within the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control is selected, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.AutoPostBack%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.CausesValidation%2A> properties to `true`, and then specify the group of controls to be validated in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.ValidationGroup%2A> property.
Displays the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList"></xref> control on the client.
This method is used primarily by control developers in custom controls that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> class.

The Render method implementation for a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control initializes a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatInfo> object for the list, and calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatInfo.RenderRepeater%2A> method, which in turn uses the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.RenderItem%2A> method to render individual radio button list items.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> that contains the output stream for rendering on the client.
Renders a list item in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList"></xref> control.
This method is used primarily by control developers in custom controls that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> class.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.Render%2A> method implementation for a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control initializes a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatInfo> object for the list, and calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatInfo.RenderRepeater%2A> method, which in turn uses the RenderItem method to render individual radio-button list items.
The RenderItem method for a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control ignores the `itemType` and `repeatInfo` parameters.

The `repeatIndex` parameter value is used to select the radio button list item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.Items%2A> collection, and the selected list item is rendered to the output stream.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemType"></xref> enumeration values.
An ordinal index that specifies the location of the item in the list control.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatInfo"></xref> that represents the information used to render the item in the list.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> that represents the output stream to render HTML content on the client.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the control is rendered if the data source has no data or if the control is not data-bound.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the control is rendered if the data source has no data or if the control is not data-bound; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the number of columns to display in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList"></xref> control.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.RepeatLayout%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout>, you can use this property to specify the number of columns that display items in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control.
If this property is not set, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control displays all items in the list in a single column.
The number of columns to display in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList"></xref>.
The default is 0, which indicates that this property is not set.
The number of columns is set to a negative value.
Gets or sets the direction in which the radio buttons within the group are displayed.
Use this property to specify the display direction of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control.
> [!NOTE] > The number of columns that are displayed is always determined by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.RepeatColumns%2A> property.

If this property is set to `RepeatDirection.Vertical` and if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.RepeatLayout%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout>, the first column is filled from top to bottom, then the next column, and so on until all items are rendered.

For example, if <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.RepeatColumns%2A> is set to 3, the items of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control are displayed in three columns.
A nine-item list would appear as follows.

|||| |-|-|-| |1|4|7| |2|5|8| |3|6|9| If this property is set to `RepeatDirection.Horizontal` and if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.RepeatLayout%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout>, the items in the list are displayed in rows loaded left to right, then top to bottom, until all items are rendered.

For example, if <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.RepeatColumns%2A> is set to 3, the items of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control are displayed in rows of three items.
A nine-item list would appear as follows.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatDirection"></xref> values.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_Vertical" name="Vertical" href=""></xref>.
The display direction of the list is not one of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatDirection"></xref> values.
Gets the number of list items in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList"></xref> control.
The RepeatedItemCount property is used primarily by control developers in custom controls that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> class.
If there are no items set in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control, the RepeatedItemCount property is zero.

If there are items set in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control, the RepeatedItemCount property is the same as the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemCollection.Count%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.Items%2A> collection.
The number of items in the list control.

Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the list will be rendered by using a <xref uid="langword_csharp_table" name="table" href=""></xref> element, a <xref uid="langword_csharp_ul" name="ul" href=""></xref> element, an <xref uid="langword_csharp_ol" name="ol" href=""></xref> element, or a <xref uid="langword_csharp_span" name="span" href=""></xref> element.
For information about the available options, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout> enumeration.
> [!NOTE] > Two options are new as of ASP.NET 4: <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout>.
Some RepeatLayout settings do not allow horizontal layout.
For more information, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout> enumeration.

A value that specifies whether the list will be rendered by using a <xref uid="langword_csharp_table" name="table" href=""></xref> element, a <xref uid="langword_csharp_ul" name="ul" href=""></xref> element, an <xref uid="langword_csharp_ol" name="ol" href=""></xref> element, or a <xref uid="langword_csharp_span" name="span" href=""></xref> element.
The default is <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout"></xref>.
The radio button layout is not one of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatLayout"></xref> values.
Processes posted data for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList"></xref> control.

Typically, you should use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.LoadPostData%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to process posted data for a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler.LoadPostData%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler> interface.
The key identifier for the control, used to index the `postCollection`.
A <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection"></xref> that contains value information indexed by control identifiers.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the server control's state changed as a result of the postback; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Raised when posted data for a control has changed.

Typically, you should use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.RaisePostDataChangedEvent%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to raise an event when the posted data for a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control changes.
The IPostBackDataHandler.RaisePostDataChangedEvent method is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler> interface.
Retrieves the style of the specified item type at the specified index in the list control.

Typically, you should use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.GetItemStyle%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to retrieve the style of an item in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control.
The IRepeatInfoUser.GetItemStyle method is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IRepeatInfoUser> interface.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemType"></xref> enumeration values.
An ordinal index that specifies the location of the item in the list.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> that represents the style of the specified item type at the specified index in the list control.
Gets a value that indicates whether the list control contains a footer section.
This property is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> instance is cast to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IRepeatInfoUser> interface.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the list control contains a footer section; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value that indicates whether the list control contains a heading section.
This property is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> instance is cast to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IRepeatInfoUser> interface.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the list control contains a header section; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value that indicates whether the list control contains a separator between items in the list.
This property is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> instance is cast to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IRepeatInfoUser> interface.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the list control contains has separators; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Renders an item in the list with the specified information.

Typically, you should use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.RenderItem%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to render items in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control.
The IRepeatInfoUser.RenderItem method is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IRepeatInfoUser> interface.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemType"></xref> enumeration values.
An ordinal index that specifies the location of the item in the list.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatInfo"></xref> that represents the information used to render the item in the list.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> that represents the output stream to render HTML content on the client.
Gets the number of items in the list control.
This property is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> instance is cast to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IRepeatInfoUser> interface.
The number of items in the control.
Gets or sets the text alignment for the radio buttons within the group.
Use this property to specify whether the text associated with the radio buttons appears on the left or right.
If this property is set to `TextAlign.Right`, the text is displayed to the right of the radio button.
If this property is set to `TextAlign.Left`, the text is displayed to the left of the radio button.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TextAlign"></xref> values.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_Right" name="Right" href=""></xref>.
The label text alignment associated with the radio buttons is not one of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TextAlign"></xref> values.
